newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - Aug 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - Aug 11.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Saudi Arabian press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Umra pilgrims form majority of overstayers.
- Saudi Arabia topped the list of Arab exporters to Egypt in the first quarter of 1997.
- Illiteracy rate in Saudi Arabia stands at 33.93 percent, the latest ministry of education statistics show. It was 37.1 percent in 1993.
- Saudi Health Minister signs a 143 million riyal hospital operating and maintenance deal with a Saudi firm.
- Saudi Alujain plans to raise its capital to 320 million riyals from a current 173 million riyals.
- Saudi to build 3.1 billion riyal water pipelines to carry drinking water to Ahsa region in the eastern province.
- Investment in paper industry producing cartons stands at 500 million riyals in Saudi Arabia.
